examples: I ate a piece of toast for breakfast.
This toast and marmalade tastes heavenly.
My toast is mixed with peanut butter.

definitions.definition: A proposed salutation (e.g. saying " cheers ") while drinking alcohol .
examples: At the reception, there were many toasts from the well-wishers.

definitions.definition: A person, group, or notable object to which a salutation with alcohol is made; a person or group held in similar esteem .
examples: He was the toast of high society.

definitions.definition: Something that is irreparably damaged or used up, especially when destroyed by heat or fire; something which has been burnt to a crisp or incinerated .
examples: The metal frame survived the fire, but the plastic and rubber bits are toast .

definitions.definition: Something that will be no more; something subject to impending destruction , harm or injury .
examples: If I ever get my hands on the guy that stole my wallet, he’s toast !

definitions.definition: A type of extemporaneous narrative poem or rap .
An old toast ("a lively fellow who drinks excessively").
A transient , informational unclickable pop-up overlay, less interactive than a snackbar .

secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A proposed salutation (e.g. saying " cheers ") while drinking alcohol .
( countable ) A person, group, or notable object to which a salutation with alcohol is made; a person or group held in similar esteem .
( uncountable , slang , chiefly US ) Something that is irreparably damaged or used up, especially when destroyed by heat or fire; something which has been burnt to a crisp or incinerated .
( uncountable , slang , chiefly US ) Something that will be no more; something subject to impending destruction , harm or injury .
( countable , music , slang , Jamaica ) A type of extemporaneous narrative poem or rap .
( countable , slang , obsolete ) An old toast ("a lively fellow who drinks excessively").
( countable , computing , graphical user interface ) A transient , informational unclickable pop-up overlay, less interactive than a snackbar .
( countable , obsolete outside India ) A piece of toast.
